name: Vegetable Meatloaf with Balsamic Glaze
headline: Vegetable Meatloaf with Balsamic Glaze
keywords: Easy Main Dish,Easy,Main Dish,Turkey Meatloaf,Meatloaf,Poultry,Turkey Recipes,Vegetable
recipeIngredient: 5 cloves garlic, smashed to a paste with coarse salt
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1/2 cup freshly grated Romano or Parmesan cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Heat the oil in a large saute pan over high heat. Add the zucchini, bell peppers, garlic paste and 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper and cook until the vegetables are almost soft, about 5 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Whisk the egg and fresh herbs in a large bowl. Add the turkey, panko, grated cheese, 1/2 cup ketchup, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar and the cooled vegetables; mix until just combined.

Gently press the mixture into a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan. Whisk the remaining 1/4 cup ketchup, 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar and 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes in a small bowl; brush the mixture over the entire loaf. Bake for 1 to 1 1/4 hours. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: May times, most requested .  BEST EVER Love, Bobby Flay, my favorite Chef.

I've made numerous meatloaves as a personal chef over 12 years.  A client asked me to make this  particular recipe and, based on reviews, I could see how to fix the small issues with the method in this otherwise delicious meatloaf.  1. Omit the panko bread crumbs and use the two whole pounds of turkey you likely purchased.  This will solve for the overly soft texture.  2. Bake at 375 for 45-50 minutes(I don't understand the crazy high temp and long cooking time).  This is more than adequate to cook your meatloaf through and your glaze won't scorch.  If you're unsure it's cooked through, poke a fork into the middle and touch it carefully to your bottom lip.  If it's truly hot to the touch it's done.  It will also visibly raise in the middle like a loaf of bread.

Very tasty. Omitted the turkey and increased the veal and pork to 1 lb each. This recipe makes 5 mini meatloaves (reduce cooking time to ~40 minutes) one gigantic one…you could easily scale it down. Also…might have been my meat choices, but there was a lot of grease that cooked out of this…I just let the loaves drain on a wire rack after resting them for 10 minutes. I would probably choose a leaner grind next time.
Delicious!! Will be making this often the only thing I added was brown sugar to the topping.
Everyone loved it. Will be making this often. Thank you Bobby. ❣️

This meatloaf is DELICIOUS!  I made a little mistake, though…. I didn’t watch it & the balsamic topping burned a little. Next time I will check it at 60 minutes. I also probably won’t put the pepper flakes in the topping. I am a spice wimp & it was just a tad too much for me. But even with those issues, I LOVED this!!! Just so good & I love that it has so many vegetables in it & is so YUMMY!  It is easy to make & I will make it again & again!

The 20 minute prep is absolutely false, however, this meatloaf is fantastic. I have made it many times and it is delicious. Highly recommend and don’t adjust the ingredients.

I made this again yesterday and used Italian squash in place of peppers, only because that’s what I had. I used a box grater instead of chopping. Big time saver and it worked just fine.
Delicious every time!

Good, but I didn't care for the balsamic vinegar glaze, even though I'm a balsamic fan. The vinegar taste of the glaze was too acidic for my taste. I prefer more of a ketchup or sweet chili sauce on top. I thought the consistency of the meatloaf was good, and liked the extra veggies added to it. Thank goodness I put a cookie sheet under the loaf pan as the glaze bubbled all over and it took me a half hour to scrub the baked on glaze off the pan.
I’ve made this for years.  Always a hit.  I substitute onion for the zucchini, and its perfect every time!

Good concept for a recipe. The meatloaf itself is too soft. Perhaps some extra breadcrumbs would help?

To make short work of the vegetable dicing pulse them in a food processor.

Love this recipe but have always had problems with it falling apart even after resting even overnight. After making it dozens of times, I decided to tackle the problem. I used an extra egg & halved the panko. Success! Sliced beautifully. Still juicy using only half the panko.
So good! I will not be using beef again to make meatloaf.

Absolutely the best!!!! I mix and match veggies sometimes and substitute Panko with quinoa…but having veggies in a meatloaf makes me actually like meatloaf again.  I’ve also made meatloafs in muffin tin, then froze the individual cooked ones.  Pop one out for a quick bite or add an egg and make it a breakfast meal.  Love love love the balsamic with ketchup blend!  Thanks!!!
delicious!

This took a while to prepare simply because of the chopping of vegetables. But it is so worth it! The flavor is so good! Next time I will double the recipe so maybe there will be leftovers!
If freezing leftovers, I would make more balsamic glaze for reheating. It seemed to lose its flavor with the freezing.

This is my favorite meatloaf recipe of all time. I make this for my family and when I have friends over. It is amazing and it is always requested. I crave it when I haven’t had it in a while. It will be in your regular rotation once you make it.
I don’t normally like meatloaf but made this for my husband and it was delicious.  I can now say I like meatloaf.  Thanks Bobby

Easy & delicious! I had 93% lean ground turkey in my freezer, so that's what I used. I added an extra egg yolk because of that and it was the only modification made. I baked it for the full hour and 15 minutes and let it rest for the full 10 minutes. Very moist and tasty. I'll definitely make this again.

This was delicious. I changed the recipe but I give full credit to Chef Flay because I used his proportions ( approximately).
Vegetables from my garden this time of year, carrots and celery replaced zucchini added 1/2 onion. Used 1 lb. turkey and 1/2 lb turkey sausage ( mild) since I had it packaged that way. No cheese for dietary reasons). I may have been heavy handed with red pepper flakes, but my husband and I love it that way. Be sure not to overwork this and to give it time to rest.

I just made this with plant based "ground beef" and it is DELICIOUS!!  I used mushrooms, onions and zucchini for the veggies.  Sometimes I use sweet potato, whatever I have on hand works.  I also added a good slug of worcestershire sauce.  BEST MEATLOAF EVER and a wonderful way to sneak in a ton of veggies without the kids knowing.  The black crusty top is the best!
This has become my go-to meatloaf recipe, after 40 years of experimenting with so many recip.  I added carrot when I didn’t have green pepper and also added a little hatch Chile for heat.
Great recipe!  I have been making this for years now.  I also make meatloaf sandwiches with the leftovers.  I love it!

Best meatloaf ever! I had beef and ground pork and medium zucchini that I shredded and squeezed in a towel. I also had to substitute matzah  for panko but the seasoning and topping were perfect…and so moist and fluffy! 425° was spot on too. But it was done after 1 hour.
Very moist, my kids loved it!

How do you make turkey moist? You make this meatloaf. And, it has veggies in it and you won’t know, it will just be tasty. I used the no sugar added Heinz ketchup and gluten-free bread crumbs and am thrilled how it came out. Thank you Bobby!
Delicious!

LOVE this recipe! I have been cooking this for probably almost 3 years now! I have gone lazy and I don’t sauté the veggies first. I have also made this with ground beef. ALL have turned out the same! My husband and I love it. It is healthy and easy!! I use it for meal prep and it holds well for reheating for the work week! A MUST try!
What can I say...Bobby Flay, all the way. Delicious!
Best. Meatloaf. Ever.

This was SO GOOD! My husband was giving me a hard time for making meatloaf but once he tasted the final product, he was speechless- mostly because he was too busy eating. I did make several substitutions based on what I had on hand, including using beef instead of turkey. I also added in carrots and red onion and only used one bell pepper. Delicious! Probably the best meatloaf I’ve ever had. Will make again!

This is the best Meatloaf  recipe I have ever made and the only one I will ever make! Chopping the veggies takes the most time so I precuts everything the night before if I can. I sometimes add more veggies then called for and I also am a bit heavy handed on the garlic and red pepper because it add a great kick. I shared this with my sister and now her family is hooked too. Thank you Bobby for a great recipe!

Grrr..so annoying when a recipe simply says to add salt and pepper.  Seems to me, at least, the salt measurement would be critical. How is one to know if the "salt to taste" method in the 1st part of a recipe will coincide with the last..especially when cheese is involved? I suppose with a little wrangling and some guessing, one could get lucky. But personally, I'm following a recipe for a reason. Just sayin'
The best meatloaf I have ever tasted!!
Hands down the best meatloaf! It comes out so moist and flavorful every single time. I follow the recipe as written. This is a family favorite that I often make for guests!

I added a comment here over a month ago.  It is awaiting moderation and was never posted.  So, I'll give it another go ... This recipe is excellent, except it has a slightly off-taste to me.  It may very well be my taste buds that are the issue, but I'd like this to post so I can get some comments/feedback.  The meatloaf is moist and flavorful otherwise.
Meatloaf it self was good. Made recipe as it was written. Only think I didn't care for was the balsamic glaze. I will make a regular ketchup glaze next time.

i followed the recipe to the letter. the texture was very mealy and was like eating wet bread crumb crumbs mixed with turkey. i would cut back on the panko. this is just my opinion but i was surprised no one else had commented on this. the flavor is good so i will make again with less crumbs.

I’ve made both of  Bobby Flay’s meatloaf recipes and both are excellent but I like this one because it uses turkey instead of red meat. I’ve made exactly like the recipe calls for and also wanted a low carb version so omitted the panko and it’s still excellent!
I've made this meatloaf several times and I love it...so much flavor and it seems healthier for me then other recipes.
You would never know this is made with turkey…delicious!

As meatloaf goes, this is beyond delicious.  My husband (hates meatloaf) asked for third servings.  Moist and flavorful.  Severed with broiled zuchinni, red and orange bell peppers for a wonderful meal.  Thanks!

Although a lot of prep work, this is THE meatloaf recipe. Moist, not dense or overworked, lots of flavor. I usually try to double the batch and freeze 1/2 so it can be enjoyed a second time without so much effort.

I have made this recipe many times.  My friends and family LOVE this!!!  It comes out so moist and flavorful!!  I followed the recipe to the T to try it first, and loved it as is.  Now I just use whatever veggies I have on hand.  Still love this... I think I'll make it tonight.

I can practically make this from memory! I usually try to get at fresh parsley, but if I don't, even fresh garlic + dried thyme and dried parsley makes for delicious flavor. I don't always have panko but italian breadcrumbs work fine. Sometimes I add extra zucchini if I have it. Everyone I've had over to eat this with us loves it!

This is an updated version of Bobby Flay's original Roasted Vegetable Meatloaf with Balsamic glaze posted in 2012. The main difference is that this is made with turkey while the original was made with ground pork, veal and chuck. The quantities of some of the ingredients also changed. My family loves the original version but I will try this one since it is a bit healthier.

Really moist and flavorful! Takes a bit of prep time but it's worth it. I would definitely make this recipe again (love that is also on the healthier side!). Only changes I made were to substitute Italian style breadcrumbs for the panko (didn't have any in my pantry) and I just minced the garlic instead of mashing it into a paste. Served the meatloaf with some spicy baked sweet potato fries.
Best meatloaf ever!!! I have never found a more tasty meatloaf recipe.
Made this turkey meatloaf for dinner,my hubby and I were blown away! Delicious. Did have a few steps but well worth the finished product. Definitely will make this again and again
What a great recipe. The flavor is amazing! I have made this at least forty times and have passed on the recipe to any family members and friends. Would not change a thing. Outstanding!

I agree with other reviewers that rated this the best meatloaf ever.  This is my go-to recipe for new moms and others in need of a meal and everyone has always RAVED about it.  I serve it with mashed sweet potatoes.  THANK YOU BOBBY!
I don't even like meatloaf and LOVED this. My only change was to add a diced onion.  This is especially good the next day as a sandwich.  Great recipe
Modified for Weight Watchers points plus: Use 1.5 cups cooked Quinoa instead of Panko, add cup of sauteed onions, a cup of sauteed celery, use reduced fat parmesan: makes 10 servings, 8 points each.
I have made this recipe for years! We love the fresh flavor from the herbs and all of the veggies packed in there. It's a bit of work, but it lasts so many meals and reheats wonderfully. LOVE IT!
Easy and delicious. I made it as is, didn't change anything. My husband loved it. Definitely saving this one to make again. I made it with a side of mock mashed potatoes  (cauliflower).
Best meatloaf ever!  I will throw out my other meatloaf recipes. I added half an onion to the vegetable medley. It was moist, flavorful, and healthy!
I followed recipe to a T!  It came out awful.  It was inedible.  I put a lot of work into preparing.  Huge waste of money!!
A lighter version than the standard meatloaf - well-suited to summer, but delicious anytime of year.

Loved it! The prep work wasn't too bad, lots of chopping but otherwise really easy. The flavor was amazing. My husband usually rolls his eyes when I suggest meatloaf - not this time. He kept getting up for more. Definitely a keeper for recipe box.

I've been using the recipe for years.  Love, love, love it.  Kids love it.  Grumpy Dad loves it.  This is a weekly staple at our house.  I've made it exactly according to the recipe, however most of the time I omit the bread crumbs.  We don't do grains.  Also, substitute no sugar catsup.  I've also used different veggies and not added the peppers if I don't have them.  Basic recipe still works, even with adjustments. Just don't skip the balsamic glaze.

This is the best meatloaf I've ever made or had. The veggies keep it so moist and light. A few alterations were made with the veggies. I added mushrooms and an onion while omitted the zucchini (which may have kept it from being overly moist as other reviewers have commented upon). We had mashed parsnips and potatoes with gravy, and a side of mixed vegetables. The balsamic vinegar with ketchup was a pleasant surprise. A little labor intensive with all the prep work, but overall definitely well worth the effort.

This was great!  I thought with the turkey it may be dry, but it was quite the opposite...perfectly moist, but still able to cut into "slices." (I baked for exactly 1 hour and let it rest 10 minutes).  I think the veggies keep it that way.  I ran out of ketchup so I supplemented it with about a Tbsp tomato sauce with some sugar and white vinegar and it still tasted great.

Excellent recipe. I sautéed sliced onions to add to the topping of ketchup and balsamic.  Used fresh hot peppers from my garden instead of pepper flakes. Perfectly tender texture. Everyone loved the hot/sweet flavor.

This meatloaf recipe was a bit more time consuming to prepare but well worth it.  Thought the flavors blended well with the veggies and the glaze was very flavorful. I noted that other reviewers commented that it fell apart while slicing. I though the mixture was kind of wet so I added more panko crumbs. It really didn't help  very good nonetheless. Will make again.

Best meatloaf recipe hands down!  My husband even asked for seconds.  He said he really likes it and believe me... he is very picky.  I thought it was delicious and very light; not heavy like a lot of meatloaf recipes.  This recipe is definitely a keeper!

I add a ton more veggies including yellow squash and onions. This creates a larger recipe so I make slightly smaller meatloaves and they freeze wonderfully! Once thawed, I make the glaze and then bake accordingly. I don't cook as long because I do smaller flatter meatloaves. SO good!

Super, super yummy!  I agree with a lot of the reviews that it may be a bit too moist so it didn't cut and serve well, but I'll just reduce some of the liquid inside next time or up the bread crumbs.  Definitely going into the rotation!! :-)
Tastes great! I actually avoided much of the ketchup and it was good still.  Only issue was my meatloaf was too moist and messy so it was hard to slice and serve guests.

This was a fantastic tasting meatloaf!  I agree with many of the reviewers that it is labor intensive, but if you've got some extra time, it is well worth the effort.  The cooking time for me was exactly 1 1/4 hours.  Really happy to find a meatloaf recipe like this!
Served this for company and it was a hit! Followed instructions and super easy to make and very moist.

Yummy yummy.  I never liked the idea of a meatloaf but I tried this one because of all the vegetables and it's awesome.  I've had rave reviews from the family.  I use ground chicken instead of the veal.
I love inviting people for dinner and seeing their confused face when I say I'm making meatloaf, then seeing the delight on their face when I serve this plate of decadence. Delicious.
LOVED this!  Had to review immediately upon eating - so good!  Hidden veggies, multi-layers of savory and sweet, no left-overs to be had.  A big winner in our house.  Will def. make again!!!

I have always enjoyed meatloaf but this recipe takes the cake! Love the flavor of the balsamic vinegar, parsley and peppers. I also added an onion in my recipe but that could be why my meatloaf was soft and really moist and not holding together when sliced ( I just can't imagine a meatloaf without onions but that's just me) It was still very tasty and I paired this with Tyler Florence's Mashed Parsnips and Potatoes and the family enjoyed. This is definitely a recipe keeper.
The best meatloaf I have ever had. I blend all the veggies so my child and husband will eat it.
The. Best. Meatloaf. Ever. Period. Takes quite a lot of time to chop everything up, but  is well worth it. Delectable.

Overall, we were very happy with how it came out.  I made a few minor changes.  I also shredded the Zucchini, and put onion in the mixture.  The balsamic glaze was a bit tangy, but thats what happens with Balsamic Vinegar. leftovers were great re-heated the next day.
Best meatloaf ever!

This was the best meatloaf!  Definitely worth the additional time spent chopping veggies  The only modification I made was to cut back by 1/3 on the bell pepper and add onions.  Also, my meatloaf was done way before the 1 hour mark so I would advise to start watching it at about 35- 40 minutes.  Very flavorful and moist.
This is our favorite meatloaf recipe ! Low calorie but high in flavor !!

This recipe is labor intensive, chopping the veggies. However, anything this good is worth it. I chopped everything in advance, and then pulled it all together at the end. Easy to make ahead so when guests are coming in the door, the only dirty pan is the meat loaf pan! Great way to get veggies into your diet, for someone like me who is not a veggie fan!
